intro: Tibisia angustifolia, commonly known as narrowleaf tibisia, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Amaranthaceae family and is characterized by its slender, upright stems and small, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in summer. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. Tibisia angustifolia is often found in rocky habitats and is considered a drought-tolerant species.
